application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1 sweet chestnut (Castanea sativa) - Re-pollard to reduce back to previous pollard point at approximately 2-2.5m 
T3 Cherry (Prunus avium) Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length. 
G12 Elm (Ulmus procera) Fell dead stem to N of group as close to ground as possible.
T13 Elm (Ulmus procera) Remove as close to trees current ground level as possible, leaving the stump in the ground.
T25 Beech (Fagus sylvatica) Reduce crown all round by 2- 3m, pruning to most recent reduction points while retaining growth to NE to help rebalance. Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length. 
G27 4x Elm (Ulmus procera)  Remove as close to trees current ground level as possible, leaving the stump in the ground.
T40 Sycamore (Acer pseudoplatanus) Remove major deadwood over 25mm diameter and/or over 1m length. Prune to give around 1.5m clearance from canopy structure and security cameras.
T44 Beech (Fagus sylvatica) Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length. 
T55 Oak (Quercus robur) Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length. Lift crown to give 5.5m ground clearance over road and 3m over footpaths and playground
T61 Yew (Taxus baccata) Fell small diameter stemmed dead tree adjacent.
T66 Sweet Chestnut (Castinea sativa) Fell small diameter stemmed dead tree adjacent. Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length.
T72 Lime (Tillia sp.) Remove major deadwood over 40mm diameter and/or over 1m length
T79  Birch (Betula pendula) Dead standing stem. Remove to leave a 0.5m standing stump
